p: Bacteriological testing was performed on a total of 31 milk samples, while pathogens were isolated in 21 (67.74%) samples. The isolated pathogens were the most common mastitis pathogens, including Streptococcus spp. Î² heamoliticus (Strep_bh), E. coli (E_c), Enterobacter sakazakii (E_s), Klebsiella oxytoca (K_o), Staphylococcus aureus (Staph_a), Staphylococcus spp. coagulase negative (Staph_cn) , Streptococcus dysgalactiae (Strep_d), Streptococcus spp. (Strep), and Streptococcus uberis (Strep_u).
